required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Hepatic Insulin Sensitivity and Very Low Density Lipoprotein Triglyceride (VLDL-TG) Kinetics
clinical_study.official_title: Basal and Insulin Mediated VLDL-triglyceride Kinetics in Obesity; Relationship With Hepatic Insulin Sensitivity

brief_summary.textblock:
Obesity is associated with dyslipidemia, which is a major risk factor for coronary heart disease. Triglycerides (TG) and cholesterol are transported in the system of lipoproteins, and the metabolism of these lipids in plasma is closely interrelated. Evidence suggests that increased concentration of very low-density lipoprotein triglyceride (VLDL-TG) is a central pathophysiological feature of the lipid and lipoprotein abnormalities in dyslipidemia.
The primary objective of this study is to investigate VLDL-TG kinetics and hepatic insulin sensitivity in age-matched obese and lean, healthy men in the postabsorptive state and during acute hyperinsulinemia using VLDL-TG and glucose tracers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: VLDL-TG kinetics are determined postabsorptively (250 minues) and during acute hyperinsulinemia (450 minutes)
primary_outcome.description: VLDL-TG secretion rates(umol/min) and clearance rates (ml/min)are determined during 30 min steady state periods postabsorptively and using acute hyperinsulinemia using primed-constant infusion of ex vivo-labelled 14C-VLDL-TG tracer and traditional tracer dilution technique.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Glucose kinetics are determined postabsorptively (250 minues) and during acute hyperinsulinemia (450 minutes)
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatic glucose production (mg/min) is determined during 30 min steady state periods postabsorptively and during acute hyperinsulinemia using primed constant infusion og 3H-glucose tracer and traditional tracer dilution technique.

intervention.description: 450 min hyperinsulinemic euglycemic glucose clamp, 0,5 mU / kg lean body mass / min

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy
- BMI < 25 kg/m2 or > 30 kg/m2
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Alcohol misuse
- Smoking
- Use of prescription drugs

overall_official.affiliation: Medical department M (Endocrinology and Diabetes), Aarhus University Hospital, Denmark

facility.name: Department of Endocrinology and Internal Medicine, Aarhus University Hospital

responsible_party.organization: Medical department M (Endocrinology and Diabetes), Aarhus University Hospital, Denmark
